title: Weather Update: Heavy Rainfall in Tamil Nadu, Kerala & Karnataka; Delhi to See Smoggy Mornings till Nov 3
text:
Weather Update: Heavy Rainfall in Tamil Nadu, Kerala & Karnataka; Delhi to See Smoggy Mornings till Nov 3 Heavy rainfall is forecasted over Tamil Nadu, Kerala, and Karnataka, while Delhi/NCR will see smog and fog during early mornings and nights. Above-normal temperatures are expected to persist across Northwest, Central, and Eastern India.
KJ Staff Updated 1 November, 2024 10:13 AM IST The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted diverse weather patterns across India in the coming days, with significant rainfall expected in parts of South India and elevated temperatures forecasted for the Northwest, Central, and Eastern regions. Additionally, residents of Delhi/NCR may encounter smog and shallow fog during night and early morning hours.
Weather Systems Influencing Rainfall The rainfall patterns are primarily due to the following weather systems:
Cyclonic Circulation over Gulf of Mannar : This system is affecting lower tropospheric levels.
Upper Air Cyclonic Circulation over Southwest Bay of Bengal : This phenomenon is occurring off the coast of south Andhra Pradesh, impacting both lower and middle tropospheric levels.
Cyclonic Circulation over Northeast Assam : This system is present in the lower tropospheric levels and will influence rainfall in nearby areas.
Rainfall Forecast and Warnings The IMD has issued a rainfall forecast with region-specific warnings:
Tamil Nadu and Sikkim : Heavy rainfall is expected at isolated locations.
Kerala, Tamil Nadu, and South Interior Karnataka : These areas may experience light to moderate rainfall accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning from October 31 to November 4.
Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal : Heavy to very heavy rainfall is expected between October 31 and November 3.
Kerala and Mahe : These regions may see heavy to very heavy rainfall from October 31 to November 3.

Temperature Forecast for the Next 7 Days Above-normal temperatures are forecasted to persist across Northwest, Central, and parts of Eastern India for the coming week:
Northwest India : Maximum and minimum temperatures are expected to remain 3-7°C above normal.
Central, Western, and Eastern India : Minimum temperatures may rise 3-5°C above typical averages.
Delhi/NCR Weather Forecast (October 31 - November 3) Delhi and the surrounding National Capital Region (NCR) are likely to experience shallow fog, mist, and smog during early morning and night hours, with fluctuating wind patterns over the next few days.
